required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 12-Week, Phase 2 Study of Gemcabene in Hypercholesterolemia Patients on Stable Moderate and High-Intensity Statins
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Week, Phase 2 Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind Study to Assess the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Gemcabene in Subjects With Hypercholesterolemia Not Adequately Controlled on High-Intensity or Moderate-Intensity Stable Statin Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to assess the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of multiple doses of gemcabene 600 mg QD compared to placebo in patients with hypercholesterolemia not adequately controlled on high-intensity or moderate-intensity stable statin therapy. Patients with HeFH, ASCVD, or otherwise uncontrolled, may be included with baseline LDL-C value ≥ 100 mg/dL. Subjects were randomized 1:1 to gemcabene 600 mg once daily (QD) or placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C at Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C by Statin Intensity Stratum
secondary_outcome.description: The intensity of statin therapy was determined based on the statin dose.Participants were categorized as high intensity & moderate intensity based on their statin doses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in LDL-C
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 2, 4, 8, 12 and average of weeks 8 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C

Percent Change From Baseline in Serum Amyloid A
Change From Baseline in Serum Amyloid A
Percent Change From Baseline in Adiponectin
Change From Baseline in Adiponectin
Change From Baseline in Framingham Risk Score
secondary_outcome.description: Framingham Risk Score was an estimate of a participant's 10-year risk of developing cardiovascular disease which was computed using sex-specific algorithms based on total point score (range less than negative 3 [best] to greater than or equal to 14 [worst] for men; less than or equal to negative 2 [best] and greater than or equal to 17 [worst] for women) : which was derived of participant's age, systolic blood pressure , smoking status, TC, HDL-C, treatment for hypertension, and diabetes status. Reported score is a percentage. Change from baseline calculated as mean at week 12 minus mean at baseline. Negative scores indicate less risk of developing cardiovascular disease.

arm_group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received matching placebo orally, once daily for 12 weeks.
Participants on stable statin therapy received 600 milligrams (mg) of Gemcabene orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: Two 300 mg tablets and 1 placebo tablet administered orally, once daily for 12 weeks.
Three placebo tablets administered orally once daily for 12 weeks.

facility.name: Westside Medical Associates of Los Angeles
Green and Seidner Family Practice Associates

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who had heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH) or atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) and were on a statin therapy were enrolled in this study.

group.title: Gemcabene 600 mg
group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received 600 milligrams (mg) of Gemcabene orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received matching placebo orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

baseline.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline efficacy assessment.

group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received 600 mg of Gemcabene orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

measure.description: Framingham Risk Score was an estimate of a participant's 10-year risk of developing cardiovascular disease which was computed using sex-specific algorithms based on total point score (range less than negative 3 [best] to greater than or equal to 14 [worst] for men; less than or equal to negative 2 [best] and greater than or equal to 17 [worst] for women) which was derived of participant’s age, systolic blood pressure, smoking status, TC, HDL-C, treatment for hypertension, and diabetes status.Reported score is a percentage.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Framingham Risk Score
outcome.description: Framingham Risk Score was an estimate of a participant's 10-year risk of developing cardiovascular disease which was computed using sex-specific algorithms based on total point score (range less than negative 3 [best] to greater than or equal to 14 [worst] for men; less than or equal to negative 2 [best] and greater than or equal to 17 [worst] for women) : which was derived of participant's age, systolic blood pressure , smoking status, TC, HDL-C, treatment for hypertension, and diabetes status. Reported score is a percentage. Change from baseline calculated as mean at week 12 minus mean at baseline. Negative scores indicate less risk of developing cardiovascular disease.
outcome.population: FAS Population. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

group.title: Gemcabene 600 mg
group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received 600 mg of Gemcabene orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received matching placebo orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Framingham Risk Score
measure.description: Framingham Risk Score was an estimate of a participant's 10-year risk of developing cardiovascular disease which was computed using sex-specific algorithms based on total point score (range less than negative 3 [best] to greater than or equal to 14 [worst] for men; less than or equal to negative 2 [best] and greater than or equal to 17 [worst] for women) : which was derived of participant's age, systolic blood pressure , smoking status, TC, HDL-C, treatment for hypertension, and diabetes status. Reported score is a percentage. Change from baseline calculated as mean at week 12 minus mean at baseline. Negative scores indicate less risk of developing cardiovascular disease.
measure.population: FAS Population. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline to end of study (Up to 113 days)
reported_events.desc: One participant received both treatments and is summarized under planned treatment (placebo) group for efficacy analysis and active treatment group (Gemcabene 600 mg) for safety analysis.

group.title: Gemcabene 600 mg
group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received 600 mg of Gemcabene orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants on stable statin therapy received matching placebo orally, once daily for 12 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
